summary: For many years, the prophecy lay undiscovered.  For the first time since High King Hjalmer’s mysterious death in 1E 222, his mighty staff is about to be re-forged. In the wrong hands, this staff could grant unimaginable power to the wielder. It is up to you, Adventurer, to make sure that doesn’t happen…
descriptionHtml:
[font=Arial][size=6][center][b][u][color=#b6d7a8]The Forgotten Prince[/color][/u][/b]
[b][u][color=#76a5af]By Team Kaleidoscopic[/color][/u][/b][/center][/size][/font]
[center][url=http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=678695465]SteamWorkshop Link

[/url][/center]
 [img]http://i.imgur.com/8SAMhXx.jpg[/img]

[font=Arial][size=3][center]Upon arriving in Morthal, you are greeted by a Courier.
He tells you that he has been hired by a mysterious Wizard named Auxentius to hand
out information to passing Adventurers. As it happens, Auxentius is looking to
hire a brave warrior to help him in a rigorous and dangerous task. It appears a
shady underground mob boss by the name of Tolldar has plans to re-forge his
ancestor’s famous staff in an attempt to fulfil the prophecy of The Forgotten
Prince and become heir to the throne of the High King of Skyrim. It is up to
the player and Auxentius to whatever it takes to ensure that he does not gain
power and control over the whole province of Skyrim!  [/center][/size][/font]

[size=3] [/size]
[b][u]
[size=5][color=#6d9eeb][center]What is The Forgotten Prince?[/center][/color]
[/size][/u][/b]
[size=3]The Forgotten Prince is a mod that adds a brand new story for the player to experience and a brand new set of challenges to overcome. With [/size][size=3]the addition of several new characters and many new locations to explore, there[/size]
[size=3]is plenty of new content to enjoy, that suits all types of players.  [/size]
[size=3]
[/size]
[b][color=#6d9eeb][size=4]Features: [/size][/color][/b]
[size=3]·       7 Brand new quest that all follow 1 new storyline.  [/size]
[size=3]·       1-5 Hours of gameplay (Depending on how much exploration is done).[/size]
[size=3]·       10 New fully voiced NPC characters.[/size]
[size=3]·       1 New spell and spell book.[/size]
[size=3]·       1 New story book.[/size]
[size=3]·       9 New discoverable locations, which include, [/size]
[size=3]·       4 Fighting pits filled with tough enemies,[/size]
[size=3]·       4 Dungeons with plenty to explore, puzzles to solve,loot to find and many tough enemies to fight. [/size]
[size=3]·       1 New world-space, separate from Skyrim[/size]
[size=3] [/size]
[size=3]Warning:We made this mod as part of our Games Design degree at University. Whilst the[/size]
[size=3]mod received a 94% grade, due to time constraints and meeting the deadlines,[/size]
[size=3]our mod is far from fully polished. Make sure to save frequently to ensure no[/size]
[size=3]progress is lost if something goes wrong (the wrong NPC accidentally dies at[/size]
[size=3]the wrong time, for example).[/size]
[size=3] [/size]
[size=3] [/size]
[b][u][color=#6fa8dc][size=5][center]What doesThe Forgotten Prince require?[/center][/size][/color]
[/u][/b]
[size=3]The Forgotten Prince only requires the Vanilla version of Skyrim.[/size]
[size=3]It does not require any DLC.[/size]
[size=3]It does not require any other mods.[/size]
[size=3]It should (untested) be fully compatible will all DLC and most popular mods.[/size]
[size=3] [/size]
[b][u][color=#8e7cc3][size=5][center]How to start The Forgotten Prince/What level should you be?[/center][/size][/color]
[/u][/b]
[size=3]To start The Forgotten Prince, travel in any way you like (Fast travel, carriage, walking etc.) to Morthal. Once there, the player will [/size][size=3]be approached by a Courier who will hand you a letter. Upon reading the letter,[/size][size=3]the first quest will begin…[/size]
[size=3]This mod does not have a level requirement and should generally scale with your characters’ level. However, it is worth noting that current [/size][size=3]feedback for the mod is that the enemies aren’t quite tough enough, so it is [/size][size=3]recommended that you play a lower level character if possible.[/size]
[size=3] [/size]
[b][u][color=#a64d79][size=5][center]Feedback/Questions:[/center][/size][/color]
[/u][/b]
[size=3]I would absolutely love to hear your feedback. Whilst we do not plan to update this mod, learning what was good and bad will greatly help [/size][size=3]us out in any future work we do.[/size]
[size=3]If you have any questions I would be more than happy to answer them in the discussion/post section below, or contact me at [/size][size=3]theinnocentpossum@hotmail.co.uk.


[/size]
[img]http://i.imgur.com/DiNUv0B.jpg[/img]
author: Team Kaleidoscopic
